passages.text: Losses could reduce in its memory and China operations; upgrade to Buy with a revised TP of MYR2.44

Inari hosted an earnings call earlier today following the announcement of its 4QFY25 results on 28 August 2025 (note). Management highlighted that FY25 was generally weaker y- y due to lower volume loadings in all business segments and less favorable forex (weaker average USD vs MYR). Profitability margins were also affected by its loss- making operations in Yiwu, China, which is averaging a MYR5mn loss per quarter.

Under its radio frequency (RF) segment, Inari is in the midst of ramping up production for upcoming launches of new iPhone models in Sept 2025. It has also started developing some new programs for 2026 models. According to management, the memory division's current run- rate is \(\sim 24k / day\) and the unit is still loss- making. To address this, it aims to reach 40k/day upon material normalization from its customer. At the same time, it is in talks with several memory customers that could pave way for volume pick- up. On automotive, management unveils some testers from peers are being transferred over by its key customer, which could double its testing volume in the new few quarters. On the opto- electronics segment, management reveals demand for legacy products remains slow but it sees increased 800G orders from a key customer for data centers usage. It also expects demand for its opto- electronics for photonics application to quadruple in FY26E. Its Philippines site will commence production of power management modules in 1QCY26. On its loss- making Yiwu operations, the group is now in active discussions with several local customers on potential mass production. This, if materialises, could help turn around the plant financially. Management remains hopeful of the proposed acquisition of Lumileds (unlisted)(note) which could help bring in new opportunities and help accelerate the group's penetration in the advanced packaging space.

We lower FY26/27F EPS by \(7 - 8\%\) , factoring in our revised USD/MYR of 4.25 (from 4.40) and raising our opex assumptions given management's continued push for new product development. We also introduce our FY28E forecasts. Rolling forward our valuation base to CY26F at an unchanged 30x P/E (+1SD), our TP now stands at MYR2.44. Given the appealing upside, we upgrade our call to Buy (from Neutral). The stock currently trades at 24.5x CY26F P/E. Key downside risks include USD/MYR fluctuations and US tariff uncertainty which could affect the demand for end- products.

Founded in 2006, INRI started out as a chip assembler and naturally progressed into a one- stop semiconductor packaging and testing services provider. Today, it is an investment holding company with its key subsidiaries being involved in offering OSAT (outsourced semiconductor assembly and test) services as well as wafer level value added services. Has manufacturing presence in Malaysia, China and Philippines.
Our TP of MYR2.44 is based on 30x CY26F P/E, which is at +1SD. The benchmark index for this stock is KLCI Malaysia.
Key downside risks include: USD/MYR fluctuations and earnings dependence on Broadcom (AVGO US, Not rated).

Nomura ESG score: 3.8/5.0. We rate Inari highly on ESG parameters, especially because of its social compliance with workforce diversity, COVID- 19 relief measures, human capital development as well as its environmental initiatives. We rate Inari 4.0/5.0 on both environmental and social parameters. We see room for improvement under its governance (rating 3.5/5.0) especially with regard to gender diversity amongst its board and composition of independent non- executive directors.

A rating of 'Buy', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to outperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduce', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies. A 'Bullish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to outperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Neutral' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to perform in line with the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. Sectors that are labelled as 'Not rated' or shown as 'N/A' are not assigned ratings. Benchmarks are as follows: United States: S&P 500; Europe: Dow Jones STOXX 600; Global Emerging Markets (ex- Asia): MSCI Emerging Markets ex- Asia. Japan/Asia ex- Japan: Sector ratings are not assigned.

A Target Price, if discussed, indicates the analyst's forecast for the share price with a 12- month time horizon, reflecting in part the analyst's estimates for the company's earnings. The achievement of any target price may be impeded by general market and macroeconomic trends, and by other risks related to the company or the market, and may not occur if the company's earnings differ from estimates.
